name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Performs structured text editing tasks including find-and-replace, applying templates, and other content transformations. Input: text content and specific editing or replacement instructions; Output: the transformed text after applying the modifications.

name: Answer Questions
definition: This capability provides general question answering using the OWL-based general task assistant. It accepts a user query in natural language as input and returns a text response that answers the query.

name: Chat with Assistant
definition: This capability offers a conversational AI assistant service that enables multi-turn dialogue. It accepts plain text queries and provides detailed, context-aware responses, including explanations, definitions, clarifications, and summaries. It combines the strengths of both implementations by supporting interactive, natural language communication across a wide range of topics.

name: Execute Academic Signal Processing Pipeline
definition: This capability performs an end-to-end academic signal processing task by sequentially executing data collection, signal interpretation, trend recommendation, and report generation. It accepts inputs such as a query date, research topic, and any additional parameters, and returns a comprehensive academic report that integrates raw data, analytical insights, and actionable recommendations.

name: Collect Academic Signals
definition: This capability collects raw academic data based on user-defined criteria such as date, research field, and keywords. It accepts these parameters as inputs and produces a dataset of academic signals, including papers, events, or other relevant academic outputs.

name: Interpret Academic Signals
definition: This capability analyzes the collected academic data to extract trends, insights, and progress in a specified research area. It accepts raw academic data or query parameters (such as date and topic) as inputs and produces a summary of interpreted trends and developments.

name: Recommend Academic Trends
definition: This capability generates actionable recommendations or predictions based on the interpreted academic signals. It accepts inputs such as analytical results or specific research focus parameters, and outputs recommendations on emerging trends or strategic research directions.

name: Generate Academic Report
definition: This capability consolidates collected academic data, interpreted insights, and trend recommendations into a comprehensive report. It accepts inputs such as processed academic signals and summary insights, and produces a formatted academic report detailing progress, trends, and actionable information.

name: Optimized User Prompt Refinement
definition: This capability accepts a user-provided prompt and, when available, specific feedback to iteratively refine and optimize the prompt. It enhances clarity, intent, and engagement by continuously incorporating user feedback and additional context, ensuring the final prompt is well-tailored for effective AI responses.

name: Generate Mermaid Diagram
definition: Creates a Mermaid diagram such as flowcharts, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, etc., based on user-provided textual descriptions and diagram requirements. Input: textual description with diagram type and details; Output: Mermaid diagram code.

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Papers
definition: This service accepts input that may be provided as a JSON object with a key 'arxiv_ids' or as natural language text containing potential ArXiv paper IDs. It extracts and validates all valid ArXiv IDs, retrieves detailed metadata for the corresponding papers, and applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and recommendation logic based on preset semantic rules. Finally, it returns a JSON list of up to 8 recommended ArXiv IDs ordered by their recommendation.

name: Extract and Analyze ArXiv Papers
definition: This capability accepts input in either natural language text or as a JSON object containing one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the input when necessary, retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, performs comprehensive content analysis, and returns a JSON list with Markdown-formatted summary reports for each paper.

name: Download and Extract Paper PDFs
definition: This capability accepts input provided either as a JSON object containing ArXiv paper IDs or as natural language text that includes one or more ArXiv IDs. It automatically extracts all valid ArXiv IDs when necessary, downloads the PDF file for each specified paper, encodes the content in Base64, and returns a JSON list where each entry is the Base64 encoded string of a corresponding PDF.
alias: Extract ArXiv IDs and Download PDFs

name: Identify Research Gaps
definition: This capability examines academic literature to detect gaps and unexplored areas in current research. It accepts inputs like the text or references to research papers and outputs a list of identified research gaps and opportunities for further investigation.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts natural language search queries or structured JSON query objects related to academic topics and retrieves relevant research papers from academic repositories (including, but not limited to, arXiv and Semantic Scholar). The output is provided in a formatted JSON structure that includes essential paper metadata such as title, authors with publication year, source, a truncated abstract if necessary, and direct links to both the paper and its PDF.

name: Comprehensive Academic Paper Analysis and Review
definition: This capability processes academic papers provided through a range of input formats—including PDF files, text input, file paths, and URLs. It automatically downloads and extracts necessary text and metadata when needed, and conducts an in-depth analysis and review. The system generates detailed Markdown-formatted reports that include comprehensive summaries, extraction of research ideas and directions, structured academic reviews, and metadata such as title, authors, publication year, and source. Additionally, the review incorporates scoring metrics for elements like methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance, along with an assessment of strengths, weaknesses, and pertinent queries.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: This capability provides information about the agent's available functions and how to use them. It accepts input in the form of greeting or help queries (such as 'Hello', 'What can you do?', etc.) and returns a textual explanation outlining the agent's capabilities, including paper review and analysis functions.

name: Browse the Web
definition: This capability accepts user queries or questions that require up-to-date information and performs a web browsing operation. It retrieves and returns relevant data or answers by searching the internet, such as current weather conditions or topic-specific information.
